articles.headline: The F.A.A. Cracks Down on Unruly Airline Passengers Ahead of Inauguration
articles.snippet: Regulators and airlines fear more disruptive and violent behavior leading up to Joe Biden’s swearing-in. Some lawmakers want rioters barred from flying.
articles.abstract: Regulators and airlines fear more disruptive and violent behavior leading up to Joe Biden’s swearing-in. Some lawmakers want rioters barred from flying.
articles.lead_paragraph: Airlines and the Federal Aviation Administration are stepping up efforts to address violence and disruption on flights and at airports ahead of next week’s presidential inauguration, citing a rise of threatening and aggressive behavior by some airline passengers before and since last week’s attack on the Capitol.
articles.byline: By Niraj Chokshi and Charlie Savage

articles.headline: Nine Michigan Leaders Face Charges in Water Crisis That Roiled Flint
articles.snippet: Ex-governor Rick Snyder was leading the state when the city’s water became tainted in 2014.
articles.abstract: Ex-governor Rick Snyder was leading the state when the city’s water became tainted in 2014.
articles.lead_paragraph: FLINT, Mich. — A queue of cars stretched for more than a half mile outside a church in Flint on Thursday morning, filled with residents waiting for free cases of bottled water, as they have since tainted water began streaming out of their taps six years ago.
articles.byline: By Kathleen Gray and Julie Bosman

articles.headline: They Can’t Leave the Bay Area Fast Enough
articles.snippet: As a tech era draws to an end, more workers and companies are packing up. What comes next?
articles.abstract: As a tech era draws to an end, more workers and companies are packing up. What comes next?
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The Bay Area struck a hard bargain with its tech workers.

articles.headline: After Barring Trump, Facebook and Twitter Face Scrutiny About Inaction Abroad
articles.snippet: Human rights groups and activists have spent years urging the companies to do more to remove content that encouraged violence.
articles.abstract: Human rights groups and activists have spent years urging the companies to do more to remove content that encouraged violence.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In Sri Lanka and Myanmar, Facebook kept up posts that it had been warned contributed to violence. In India, activists have urged the company to combat posts by political figures targeting Muslims. And in Ethiopia, groups pleaded for the social network to block hate speech after hundreds were killed in ethnic violence inflamed by social media.

articles.headline: Abandon Trump? Deep in the G.O.P. Ranks, the MAGA Mind-Set Prevails
articles.snippet: As President Trump prepares to exit the White House, his ideas, including falsehoods and conspiracy theories, continue to exert a gravitational pull among grass-roots G.O.P. officials.
articles.abstract: As President Trump prepares to exit the White House, his ideas, including falsehoods and conspiracy theories, continue to exert a gravitational pull among grass-roots G.O.P. officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Cleveland County, Okla., the chairman of the local Republican Party openly wondered “why violence is unacceptable,” just hours before a mob stormed the U.S. Capitol last week. “What the crap do you think the American revolution was?” he posted on Facebook. “A game of friggin pattycake?”
articles.byline: By Lisa Lerer and Reid J. Epstein

articles.headline: Unemployment Claims Rise Sharply, Showing New Economic Pain
articles.snippet: Weekly filings for jobless benefits hit the highest level since July as the pandemic’s resurgence batters the service industry.
articles.abstract: Weekly filings for jobless benefits hit the highest level since July as the pandemic’s resurgence batters the service industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ten months after the coronavirus crisis decimated the labor market, the resurgent pandemic keeps sending shock waves through the American economy.

articles.headline: Senate Plans Trial for Trump as G.O.P. Weighs Risks of Convicting
articles.snippet: Senate leaders were working to agree on a dual track to try the departing president at the same time it considered the agenda of the incoming one, an exercise never tried before.
articles.abstract: Senate leaders were working to agree on a dual track to try the departing president at the same time it considered the agenda of the incoming one, an exercise never tried before.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A day after the House impeached President Trump for inciting a violent insurrection at the Capitol, Democrats and Republicans in the Senate were developing plans on Thursday to try the departing president at the same time as they begin considering the agenda of the incoming one.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Catie Edmondson

articles.headline: As Trump Clashes With Big Tech, China’s Censored Internet Takes His Side
articles.snippet: Blurring the distinction between companies and government, official propaganda outlets use President Trump’s ouster from Twitter and Facebook to argue that nobody in the world enjoys free speech.
articles.abstract: Blurring the distinction between companies and government, official propaganda outlets use President Trump’s ouster from Twitter and Facebook to argue that nobody in the world enjoys free speech.
articles.lead_paragraph: After Twitter and Facebook kicked President Trump off their platforms, and his supporters began comparing his social media muzzling to Chinese censorship, the president won support from an unexpected source: China.

articles.headline: Tesla Might Finally Have Some Competition. From Ford.
articles.snippet: Traditional automakers have struggled to sell electric cars. That could change as Ford, Volkswagen and others introduce new models.
articles.abstract: Traditional automakers have struggled to sell electric cars. That could change as Ford, Volkswagen and others introduce new models.
articles.lead_paragraph: A few weeks before Christmas, San Tan Ford, a dealership in the Phoenix area, invited car buyers to gawk at the Mustang Mach-E, a highly anticipated electric car that Ford Motor recently started selling.

articles.headline: TikTok Is Poised to Outlast Trump, and to Test Biden
articles.snippet: It is unclear how the president-elect will approach the Chinese tech industry.
articles.abstract: It is unclear how the president-elect will approach the Chinese tech industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: TikTok is about to outlast President Trump. Now, the company could become an early test of President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s stance toward Chinese tech companies.

articles.headline: Blue-Collar Boom: How China Bounced Back From the Virus
articles.snippet: Officials pushed factories to reopen the same way they forced the country to shut down. In one small town, it led to a chili-sauce-fueled revival.
articles.abstract: Officials pushed factories to reopen the same way they forced the country to shut down. In one small town, it led to a chili-sauce-fueled revival.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHANGMINGZHEN, China — The smell, salty and pungent, wafts through the freshly paved streets near the gleaming new factory.
